content:
• Monday, September 8, 2014

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BNNY +37.2%. WWAV +5.2%. NVTL +4.4%. TRLA +4.2%. ECYT +4.1%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RPM -7.7%. PBY-OLD -7.3%. FCEL -4.9%. PF -3.9%. GV -3.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • HAIN

    Annie's sale to General Mills has other names stirring

    • On the move following Annie's sale to General Mills for a 37% premium to today's closing price are: Hain Celestial (NASDAQ:HAIN) +2.3% after-hours, B&G Foods (NYSE:BGS) +2.2%, WhiteWave Foods (NYSE:WWAV) +4.8%, Medifast (NYSE:MED) +2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • GIS

    General Mills buying Annie's in $820M deal

    • General Mills (NYSE:GIS) boosts its organic and natural foods offerings with an agreement to purchase Annie's (NYSE:BNNY) for $46 per share in cash. The deal will be funded through available credit and the purchase is expected to be accretive to earnings in year one.
    • General Mills CEO Jeff Harmening: "We believe that combining the Annie's product portfolio and go-to-market capabilities with General Mills' supply chain, sales and marketing resources will accelerate the growth of our organic and natural foods business."
    • BNNY +37.4%, GIS +0.2% AH
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 5 Comments
  • BX

    Pinnacle Foods -4.3% as Blackstone sells

    • Blackstone (NYSE:BX) is offering 15M shares of Pinnacle Foods (NYSE:PF) with the underwriters granted the option to buy another 2.25M shares.
    • PF -4.3% AH
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • DOC

    Physicians Realty Trust announces secondary offering, acquisition activity

    • The offering is for 9M shares with underwriters granted a greenshoe option for another 1.35M.
    • The company closed $20.7M of new investments in the first week of September in two separate deals. The two purchases are expected to provide an unlevered year one cash yield of about 7.5%.
    • DOC -3.9% AH
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • TNET

    TriNet -3.1% as P-E owner sells

    • Entities associated with General Atlantic, LLC are offering 10.5M shares of TriNet (NYSE:TNET), with underwriters granted a greenshoe option of 1.575M shares.
    • TriNet is ahead by nearly 50% since its March IPO, but is lower by 3.1% after-hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • BABA

    Yahoo +5.4% behind Ailbaba IPO filing

    • In what may be the first coverage of Alibaba (NYSE:BABA), Atlantic Equities' James Cordwell - expecting the company to continue to gobble up share - rates the stock Overweight with $100 price target (current IPO price range is $60-$66).
    • The biggest risk to the outlook, he says, is Alibaba not owning fulfillment centers. It's an approach that has worked well so far, says Cordwell, "but that could become a weakness as competitors extend their in-house capabilities.”
    • As for Yahoo (YHOO +5.4%), Cantor's Youssef Squali says the company should end up with about $8.8B in gross proceeds and $5.7B net (though tax treatment could increase this amount) after selling 140M shares of its 523.6M share stake in Alibaba. He's got a Buy rating and $39 price target on Yahoo, but thinks the Alibaba IPO could boost the stock to $49.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 12 Comments
  • TWTR

    Twitter testing "Buy" button

    • "This is an early step in our building functionality into Twitter (TWTR +2.5%) to make shopping from mobile devices convenient and easy, hopefully even fun," says Group Product Manager Tarun Jain in a blog post. Among those whom early testers will be abel to buy from is Home Depot.
    • After the first transaction which may take a few taps of a mobile keyboard, payment and shipping information will be stored (should the buyer choose to do so), making any future purchases possible with little more than a tap or two.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 5 Comments
  • MXC

    Mexco Energy +14% on additional development of properties

    • Mexco Energy (MXC +13.7%) says three new wells in the Wolfcamp play in Texas were averaging nearly 878K cf/day of natural gas and 883 boe/day during the first 11 days of production.
    • The three wells are the first of seven to be drilled to a vertical depth of 8K ft. and a horizontal length of 7,150 ft.; MXC's interest in the wells is 1.45% working interest.
    • MXC also says it is buying royalty interests in 43 wells, mostly in Texas and Louisiana, for $200K.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras -5% on Brazil bribery allegations

    • Petrobras (PBR -5.2%) plunges on news about a police investigation into alleged payments to government officials, just a month ahead of Brazil's presidential election.
    • An ex-director of the oil company reportedly is accusing at least 40 politicians of involvement in a kickback scheme; among those named are a government minister and various governors and congressmen, some of them members of the governing Workers Party and groups which back Pres. Rousseff.
    • Eduardo Campos, the presidential candidate who died in a plane crash last month, was named as one of the politicians supposedly involved; PBR “has been destroyed by its political use, corruption and handing out favors,” according to Marina Silva, who replaced Campos as presidential candidate.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • ACFN

    Acorn Energy +12% on new order for nuclear plant protection

    • Acorn Energy (OTC:ACFN +12.2%) surges after announcing its DSIT Solutions sonar technology subsidiary received another order for its underwater security system to monitor and protect nuclear power plants.
    • ACFN expects installation before the end of the year, adding that the order arrived less than two weeks after it announced a similar order from an European nuclear plant operator.
    • Financial details of the order were not disclosed.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • BA

    Barron's: Boeing shares should overcome worries about cyclical order peak

    • Boeing (BA +2.7%) shares could climb 20% over the next year to $150, Barron's believes, as growing demand for flights, especially in emerging markets, combined with fuel-efficiency gains and cheap financing, should keep earnings moving steadily higher and free cash flow soaring.
    • Boeing's modest cancellation rate plus an order backlog equal to nearly five years' worth of revenue provides excellent visibility into near-term demand; Boeing predicts global air traffic will rise 5%/year over the next two decades as middle classes expand in emerging markets, creating a need for the global airline fleet to expand from 21K planes now to 42K by 2033.
    • Shares look affordable too, at 14.8x projected earnings for the next four quarters, a 8% discount to where they have traded over the past 15 years and a 6% discount to the S&P 500 vs. a historical 4% premium.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • EQNR

    Statoil, Rosneft Arctic well off Norway held up by Greenpeace

    • Statoil's (STO -1.9%) first well off Norway with Russia's Rosneft (OTCPK:RNFTF) may be delayed following a Greenpeace complaint that says the well is too close to the Bear Island nature reserve and the polar ice cap.
    • Drilling can’t start on the Statoil-operated Pingvin prospect in the Barents Sea until the appeal has been handled this week by Norway's environment regulator.
    • The complaint comes as Rosneft, which owns a 20% stake in license 713 where Pingvin is located, faces sanctions due to Russia’s involvement in the Ukraine conflict.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • KERX

    Keryx down again today

    • Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (KERX -11%) slumps again on a 5x surge in volume. Shares are off ~17% from the August 28 peak of $18.48. On Friday, the FDA approved ferric citrate for the control of serum phosphate levels in patients with chronic kidney disease on dialysis.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 10 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: RADA +56%. MBLX +30%. MGAM +29%. BKYF +28%. OTC:GIGA +24%. IHT +22%. RMGN +18%. OTC:GLRI +16%. MXC +14%. IPCI +13%.
    • Top 10 Losers: VII -12%. ESYS -10%. DGLY -9%. KERX -9%. RVLT -9%. WRLD -9%. COUP -8%. TRMR -7%. CPE -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • VRA

    Volatility picks up with Vera Bradley

    • Shares of Vera Bradley (VRA +7.2%) are on the move on heavy volume to reach their highest level since early June.
    • Though there's been some hints with recent channel checks that the retailer's back-to-school season sales will come in ahead of beat-down estimates, today's action is being tied by analysts to momentum.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • NFX

    Brent crude slides below $100 for the first time in more than a year

    • The day's five biggest decliners in the S&P 500 are all energy companies - Newfield Exploration (NFX -5.6%), EOG Resources (EOG -3.6%), Anadarko Petroleum (APC -2.9%), Cimarex Energy (XEC -3.3%) and Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD -3.4%) - as crude oil prices slide to new lows, including Brent crude's first move below $100/bbl in more than a year.
    • Brent crude dropped $1.12, or 1.1%, to $99.70/bbl after falling to as low as $99.36, a 16-month low, while U.S. crude slipped more than a percent to below $92 after settling at $93.29 on Friday for its sixth weekly drop in seven.
    • Traders are concerned crude demand won't keep up, with data from the U.S. and China, the world's top oil consumers, suggesting their economies aren't growing as quickly as had been hoped.
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UCO, SCO, XOP, BNO, DTO, DBO, IEO, CRUD, PXE, USL, DBE, UWTI, OTC:DWTI, DNO, RJN, SZO, OLO, JJE-OLD, ONG, RGRE, OLEM, UBN
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 17 Comments
  • Z

    Zillow and Trulia lower ahead of Citron presentation

    • Though the title of Andrew Left's presentation tomorrow at the Value Investing Congress - "The Myth of Zulia" - has been known for over a week, it's as good of an excuse as any for today's downward slide in Zillow (Z -4.2%) and Trulia (TRLA -4.2%).
    • Citron's original bearish report on Zillow was almost two years ago to the day. The stock's roughly a three-bagger since.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • GG

    Goldcorp CEO Jeannes sees peak gold this year or xext

    • Miners have reached "peak gold," in which gold production has hit its high as easy-to-mine gold deposits become harder to find, Goldcorp (GG -2.4%) CEO Chuck Jeannes tells WSJ.
    • Jeannes says a falloff in supply will support the gold price but make mining it even harder and lead to further consolidation in the industry; yet investors are wrong to believe GG is poised to make acquisitions of its own, he says.
    • Gold production has been on the upswing since the late 1970s, hitting 2,270 metric tons last year, but Jeannes believes that without a dramatic technological advance gold production is unlikely to increase during his career.
    • ETFs: GDX, NUGT, DUST, GLDX, RING, GGGG, SGDM, PSAU
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 9 Comments
  • SGI

    Davidson buys the dip in Silicon Graphics

    • Noting valuation and the SAP high-performance analytic appliance opportunity, DA Davidson, upgrades Silicon Graphics International (SGI +8.5%) to a Buy with price target lifted to $12 from $10.
    • SA Pro's Ashraf Eassa was similarly bullish about a month ago at about the same price as today's pre-upgrade level.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • SDRL

    Seadrill started at Sell by Canaccord, seeing dividend cut

    • Seadrill (SDRL -2.2%) is initiated with a Sell rating at Canaccord, which believes oil prices are not high enough to generate adequate returns for investors and that the company could cut its dividend.
    • After the long drilling boom, only one long-term deepwater booking has been posted since Aug. 2013, while ample supply, few bookings and new operators are slowing retirement of old rigs, the firm says.
    • SDRL’s cash flow to equity is "much, much weaker than it appears," Canaccord says; its refinancing needs are "ferocious," with more than $4B by year-end 2015 - including $3Bbn in dividend payments - secured against a shrinking contract backlog.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 67 Comments
  • HTZ

    More on Hertz's management changes

    • Shares of Hertz (HTZ +1.1%) settle back after an initial rush following news that CEO Mark Frissora would step down.
    • Frissora's departure follows a few weeks after the disclosure of 8.48% stake in Hertz by Carl Icahn.
    • The activist investor's investment came with a plan for improvement for the company and a vote of no-confidence in management.
    • Veteran board member Linda Fayne Levinson has been tapped to be the non-executive chairwoman at Hertz.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • RENT

    Rentrak on the move after Needham chimes in

    • Rentrak (RENT +6.2%) rallies after Needham initiates coverage with a Buy rating.
    • The investment firm sets a price target of $64 on Rentrak on its view the company still has plenty of untapped potential to add new media clients.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • GST

    Gastar says first dry gas Utica well performs above expectations

    • Gastar Exploration (GST +2%) moves higher in early trading after saying its first Utica/Point Pleasant natural gas well produced at a better than expected initial 48-hour gross sales rate of 29.4M cf/day.
    • GST says it anticipates an additional three gross wells will be placed on flow back before the end of Q3.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • SVRA

    Mast Therapeutics reports clinical results for PAH product candidate

    • Shares of Mast Therapeutics (MSTX +7%) jump in response to its report of positive results from a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating the safety and efficacy of AIR001 (sodium nitrite) for the treatment of patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH). In the primary efficacy analysis, all doses showed improvement in median vascular resistance (PVR). In the secondary efficacy analysis, all doses showed improvements in the median distances achieved in the 6-minute walk test, including clinically-meaningful improvements at the highest dose level. Whether the results are statistically significant is unknown.
    • Methemoglobin levels remained normal (<1.5%) which is a positive since elevated levels are associated with IV-administered nitrite.
    • Mast obtained the rights to AIR001 from its acquisition of privately-held Aires Pharmaceuticals in February of this year.
    • The study was powered to enroll 90 patients but Aires discontinued enrollment due to the lack of capital. The reported data is from 29 subjects.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • BKYF

    BB&T agrees to purchase Bank of Kentucky

    • The Bank of Kentucky Financial Corporation (BKYF +28.3%) is headquartered in Crestview Hills, and has $1.9B in assets, $1.6B in deposits, and 32 branches in Northern Kentucky and Cincinnati. BB&T (BBT) is purchasing the lender in a cash and stock deal valued at about $363M.
    • In connection with the purchase, BB&T creates a new banking region encompassing Northern Kentucky and Cincinnati.
    • BKYF owners will receive 1.0126 shares of BB&T common stock and $9.40 in cash for each share of BKYF they own, roughly equivalent to $47 per share at current prices.
    • BB&T expects the deal to be accretive to EPS in the first full year.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • HPTX

    Hyperion off premarket after announcement of misbehavior in diabetes trial

    • Hyperion Therapeutics (NASDAQ:HPTX) is off 11% premarket on average volume after the company announced that it terminated the development of DiaPep277 for newly-diagnosed Type 1 diabetes after discovering serious misconduct between recently-acquired Andromeda Biotech and an Israeli biostatistics firm. Apparently, the two organizations colluded to share unblinded DIA-AID 1 trial data and then use the data to manipulate the analyses to obtain a favorable result. It also discovered that certain Andromeda employees continued improperly sharing unblinded data from the ongoing DIA-AID 2 trial.
    • Hyperion suspended the Andromeda employees involved in the matter and has notified regulatory authorities. It is also exploring its legal options. No Hyperion employees were involved in any of the misconduct.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • WRLD

    World Acceptance tumbles as auditor resigns

    • The payday loan player is lower by 8.7% premarket after announcing the resignation of KPMG as its auditor. WRLD is in the final stages of selecting a new auditor.
    • SEC Form 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: MGAM +29%. RADA +8%. HTZ +5%.
    • Losers: HPTX -10%. WRLD -9%. KERX -8%. DGLY -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • BAC

    Bank of America boosted by Goldman upgrade

    • "The major catalyst for shares in our opinion is the resolution of the bulk of Bank of America's (NYSE:BAC) legal issues with its AG settlement," says analyst Richard Ramsden, upgrading to a Buy with price target lifted to $19 from $17.
    • "Legal costs have obscured much of the fundamental improvement at BAC."
    • Shares +1.1% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM | 12 Comments
  • HTZ

    Hertz CEO to step down, shares +5.2%

    • Hertz (NYSE:HTZ) announces CEO and Chairman Mark Frissora will resign due to personal reasons.
    • The company says Brian MacDonald will step in to serve as interim CEO.
    • MacDonald is the top exec of the Hertz Equipment Rental business.
    • HTZ +5.2% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
  • BCS

    KPMG: U.K.'s big banks cut lending by more than half a trillion dollars

    • "A wall of money has gone out of the banks and into fines and redress," says KPMG's U.K. head of banking Richard McCarthy. "Hopefully the most egregious things have come out and hopefully the banks will be able to move forward."
    • Over the last five years, according to KPMG, the U.K.'s largest banks - BCS, RBS, HSBC, LYG, OTCPK:SCBFF - have cut consumer and business lending by $595B, or 14%.
    • "There is light at the end of the tunnel," says McCarthy, with the report noting redress costs and fines fell 44% to £2.4B in 2014's first six months from a year ago.
    • Meanwhile, the banks are sharply lower premarket over Scottish independence jitters. BCS -3.5%, RBS -4.1%, LYG -4.9%, HSBC -2%.
    • Previously: Cable tumbles over Scotland referendum
     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM | 11 Comments
  • RBS

    RBS launches Citizens Financial IPO

    • RBS is offering 25% or 140M shares of its U.S. banking subsidiary Citizens Financial Group at an expected price range of $23-$25 per share. The underwriter greenshoe is for another 21M shares.
    • The stock will trade on the NYSE under the symbol CFG.
    • Prospectus
    • RBS is lower by 4.1% premarket, thanks to jitters about Scottish independence, with a weekend poll showing those favoring a breakup with the U.K. pulling past those against for the first time. The referendum date is September 18.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 AM
  • AKS

    AK Steel in concurrent offerings of stock, notes

    • AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) -2.8% premarket after announcing concurrent offerings of stock and senior notes.
    • AKS says it is launching an offering of 35M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 5.25M shares; AKS also is offering a total of $430M in senior notes due 2021.
    • The company plans to use all proceeds from the notes plus part of the proceeds from the stock sale to fund the acquisition of steel plants from Severstal Dearborn.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM
  • CPB

    More on Campbell Soup's FQ4

    • Campbell Soup (NYSE:CPB) reports organic sales fell 2% in FQ4.
    • Acquisitions added 3% to growth while promotional spending clipped 2%.
    • Gross margin rate -210 bps to 34.1%.
    • Segment growth: U.S. Simple Meals +5% to $518M; Global Baking and Snacking +10% to $628M; International Simple Meals and Beverages +1% to $188M; U.S. Beverages +6% to $184M; Bolthouse and Foodservice +11% to $334M.
    • Guidance: Full-year EPS of $2.45-$2.60 expected vs. $2.54 consensus.
    • CPB -1.9% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:48 AM
  • AIG

    AIG boosted by Citigroup coverage

    • Noting an improved balance sheet and hopes for better margins, Citigroup starts AIG with a Buy.
    • Shares +0.8% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:30 AM | 4 Comments

  • Cable tumbles over Scotland referendum

    • For the first time a majority of voters favor Scottish independence (47% vs. 45% against), according to a weekend poll. The vote is set for September 18.
    • A yes vote, says SocGen's Kit Juckes, "would increase moves for secession across Europe, increase the momentum for the U.K. to leave the EU and hurt Scottish economic growth potential." He reckons it could take the pound down by perhaps another 5%.
    • Sterling is lower by 1.25% vs. the dollar to $1.6119, its weakest in nearly a year. It's down a similar amount vs. the euro. The FTSE is also a laggard to the downside this morning, down 1.1%.
    • Pound ETFs: FXB, GBB
    • British equity ETFs: EWU, EWUS, FKU, DXPS, DBUK, QGBR
     
     
     
     
    | 7:22 AM
  • F

    Morgan Stanley sours on Ford

    • Morgan Stanley pushes Ford (NYSE:F) down to an Underweight rating from a lofty Overweight position.
    • The investment firm sets a $16 price target on shares of the automaker.
    • F -2.0% premarket to $16.80.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:53 AM | 52 Comments
